title: Kentucky man charged with shooting juvenile in neck
content:
TODD COUNTY, Ky. (WKRN) – A Kentucky man was arrested Thursday after he accidentally fired a gun which struck a juvenile in the neck.
The Kentucky State Police responded to a shooting call in Elkton around 1:30 p.m.
Clarksville Now reported investigators determined that Jayson Stewart, 20, was handling a .22 caliber handgun when it discharged and struck a juvenile in the neck.
The juvenile was air lifted to Vanderbilt University Medical Center with serious injuries and is currently in stable condition.
Stewart was booked into the Todd County jail and charged with first-degree assault.
